page.title: 10PARNDON NATURE RESERVE
page.content: Little Parndon Nature Reserve covers 31 hectares of land and is surrounded by a high wire fence to stop vandals.There has been a wood here since the 12th century,and it has been a Nature Reserve,owned by the local Council,since 1978. The Reserve is open to the public on Sundays and Tuesday evenings.It receives up to 12,000 visitors a year and about 4 school parties a week,who follow the two Nature Trails or use the two bird hides. The Reserve is home to 20 kinds of mammal,70 species of birds,200 species of butterflies and moths and an estimated ten million ladybirds.
